data.title: Git er dun
data.text: The best coney dogs, atmosphere, and friendly staff. I'm having Coney, fries and beer for early lunch Monday morning. The best ever. I drive from southern Minnesota  for the experience. Are you experienced? I am. Jimi.

data.title: I'll come back for more
data.text: I liked it a lot, reading the other reviews on Yelp and google it made it seem like i might walk into a klan rally, but it wasn't at all. There is no racist feeling there at all. The bartender was very nice and friendly "hey bud what can I get for you? Do you need anything else? Thanks have a good day!" The coneys were good, the service was fast and friendly, and the cost was cheap.

data.title: Fantastic coney islands!
data.text: Not the place to take your new in-laws, however, if you want the best coney islands in the Twin Cities, the Gopher Bar is it!

data.title: DOWN AND DIRTY
data.text: BEST OLD FASHIONED CONEY DOGS ANYWHERE. Basic bar that specilizes in coney's and not much else. Not the cleanest place but worth a stop.

data.title: Great Hockey Dive Bar
data.text:
This is great spot for MN sports guys. Cold beer, great coney islands. You better order cheese and onions or you will here about it. 

The owners are great people. Be careful bringing kids in.

data.title: st paul.institution
data.text: Great drinks, and bar food, get the Coney or a greasy cheeseburger.  Big Vulcan bar, lots of St Paul soul.

data.title: Best Dive Bar in St. Paul [possibly one of the best in the US?]
data.text:
Best Dive Bar in St. Paul. Seriously. Might even be one of the best damn dive bars in the world.
 
Where else can you have stickers placed upon you that say: EAT A CONEY AT THE GOPHER BAR OR GET $@$#&%. Tacky? Yes. Tons of fun? Obviously.

RECOMMENDATION: Try a coney -- or else (see above)

DRINK RECOMMENDATION: Yes, please. We sampled a variety of beer and spirits and found them all to be wonderfully acceptable served with the right amount of crass for just the right price. 

COMING HERE IS AN EXPERIENCE. DO YOURSELF A FAVOR; TRY IT.

data.title: Great dive bar
data.text: My family and friends have been going to this bar for years. Yeah it's a little rough around the edges, get over it. They have good coney's and strong drinks. It's not your coffee shop kind of bar or crowd, it's a dive bar that is fun and everyone seems to be having a good time. In my opinion, I think it's worth checking out. The fries are decent and the poppers are good as well.

data.title: It Is What It Is
data.text: Plain and simple, it's a cool little bar. If you have nothing better to do than study everything on the walls, I suggest you hang with better company. Yes, there is a Confederate flag and some old stickers on a wall or two.  If it offends you, leave, if it doesn't, stay and enjoy a drink and a Coney. The staff was very nice and helpful. I can't attest to the state of the bathrooms, but our table was clean.

data.title: The University needs to have this logo/name revoked; astonishingly horrible place
data.text:
Offensive to the max: photo's of Obama with joker makeup painted on, Tea Party/Republican hate messages scribed all over the place, catering to the dumbest of the dumb. I left disgusted without even ordering a beer. People like this are why the world hates America. Americans aren't disgusting; Republicans/Tea Party are.
How the University of Minnesota allows this is beyond me.

data.title: Poor excuse for a Coney
data.text:
Sorry, but this place is a dump that hides its mediocre food in a shroud of 'tough guy' paraphernalia. The coney wasn't worth the money or effort. 

It's hard to understand how they dare fly the confederate flag in a state where thousands of men were killed fighting to preserve the Union. But, the lack of thought and caring is clearly evident in the food and service. There are better options than this dump that won't insult your intelligence or taste buds.

data.title: Kinda scary.
data.text: Known for its Coney Island hot dogs, this place has the recipe down and they're good.  Whats off is some of the stuff on the walls, like the confederate flag.  We're pretty sure that if they'd known we were a gay couple they wouldn't have served us.  Although we thought the Coney's were great, we won't be back.  Just didn't seem safe for us.

data.title: Conservative Hang Out, Super Casual, with Great Coneys!
data.text: This "corner pub" style gathering place expresses the owners "conservative views" in the signage and decor.  If you are easily offended by this honest expression of his beliefs this is not the place for you.   On the other hand if you don't mind a little off-color language, some good natured ribbing,  are open minded and have some conservative attributes then this is definitely your place.   Very Casual and comfortable, its the best place in the Twin Cities to get some delicious "coney island" hot dogs.  George, the owner and Cheri his wife and the waitress serve up some of the best.  George even grills the buns. The Menu is short and beverages are limited to bar drinks, beer and soft drinks. When your coney's are served you won't get a plate and silverware, just a piece of waxed paper.. This is "hands on" food and meant to be consumed "hand to mouth" so to speak.  Bring cash as checks and credit cards are "outlawed".

data.title: interesting place if you're adventureous
data.text: great chili dogs and many "colorful" signs suggesting you don't ask to write a check. downtown and easy to get to.

data.title: Great coney
data.text:
My husband and I decided it was coney time. After a little investigation we headed off to the Gopher Bar. I'll grant you it's not the prettiest place I ever been to but it definitely had atmosphere. The server asked if we'd been in before and since we hadn't we were deemed to be "virgins". Now the sweetest part of the visit was the server being kind of apologetic for giving us the stickers they put on virgins. I assured her that even tho we are into our 60's we are good sports. 
Ok, onto the important info, loved the coney and fries! I was so thrilled that the buns were the old fashioned toasted bread type. Worth the trip.

data.title: its still fun
data.text: i used to stop in for lunch time in winter, and georges mom would serve me some awesome soups along with those coneys....this was a horrible place to stop off at noon, mainly because after a few cold beers and a few great tasting coneys, I had no intention of going back to work,lol....many a good day the company had a hard time getting me on the radio cause I was sitting there shooting the crap with George about hockey,,,damn fine memories, and damn fine place, ty guys..........all in all, you would have to look hard and long to fine a place with this much fun history to it, and getting treated like crap,lol,,its like being married all over again,,,,,,,,,,,,

data.title: Bring cash and a sense of humor.
data.text:
If you've ever wanted to see a confederate flag in the colors of the University of Minnesota, look no further.  If you are easily offended OR think this is a seedy version of the MOA's 'Dicks Last Resort' with faked rudeness, I would pass.  
Also- do not wear anything that you don't want to smell like old grease and smoke.  The amount that this place will permeate your clothes is breathtaking (literally).  
All that being said, I love this place and will continue stinking up my hamper with Gopher Bar-worn jeans until they put me in the ground. 
Oh yes- the food.  The coneys are simple and perfect.

data.title: The BEST hotdogs in town!
data.text: This little venerable dive bar has not changed in years.  Very much a blue collar kind of place with great food and nice folks.  The dogs are a little small, so be ready to eat at least 2!  They are well worth the price.

data.title: Not For The Faint Of Heart
data.text:
I said eat, eat, eat, eat, eat (Eat, eat, eat, eat, eat), 'Cause you make me feel, like eating Coney's, they're so good, eating Coney's. What place can make me feel like eating Coney's? A tiny little hole-in-the-wall called the Gopher Bar in downtown St. Paul and a place not for the faint of heart. 

You will need some thick skin to enter the Gopher Bar and if you're easily offended, the Gopher Bar should be on your skip list. For instance, their shirt has a saying on the back that I will refrain from posting here and the menu provides you with instructions on how to order your Coney; Sit Down! Shut Up & Wait Your Turn!. Well, that's exactly what my wife and I did as we were laughing at all the funny signs they have hanging up that yes, would offend some people. 

It's definitely a place you would find Billy Idol in and if you can get past their unique (to say the least) marketing, they are serving an outstanding Coney Island hot dog that you should try yourself. Two ways to order them up, with cheese and without - pretty simple and straight forward. I went with cheese while my wife went without and they pile on the chili and onions and pile on they indeed do! I love hot sauce and noticed a bottle of delicious Sriracha just looking at me and telling me to put it on my Coney, so I obliged. I used to eat Coney's growing up doing youth hockey fundraisers and they were never this good!  The chili was awesome, as you bite into the dogs, they had a nice snap to them (as they should) and the buns were grilled nicely as well. 

All-in-all, these things were awesome and I would recommend adding a little Sriracha to it, it makes everything that much better. The Gopher Bar is a simple place, they only accept cash and they don't take crap from anyone and they're not afraid to let you have it if you're acting out of line. They have some other items on the menu, 11 to be exact, but the Coney is what you should be going here for any ways. While you're there, you might as well stay and have a few adult beverages as well. Just be nice to your bartender, even toilets can only handle one _____ at a time! Yes, that's actually a sign behind the bar!

data.title: Love the flags
data.text: The food here is marginal . They will have either PBR or Old Style on tap which I enjoy. The prices are fair but not cheap. As others have posted this place is a dive but that is what makes it a great place to go,unless you are a thin skinned Mn liberal. The Confederate flags add a bit of intimidating charm. The bathrooms disgusting and probably meant to be that way. If you catch George, the owner in a good mood ( tough to do) he will put a bottle on the bar and drink it with you like in the old west. His wife Cheri is a hoot and about as foul mouthed as possible. Many have stated that this place is racist and maybe so but liberals hate George because he cannot be forced to accept their doctrine. I have never seen him treat a person of color badly regardless of his personal beliefs. Liberals love to pass laws to make you agree with them and George could not care less. Bring cash as that is all they accept . Try to rob the place and you will likely regret it. (Enough said) . This is not a place for kids in my opinion. (Or for Obama fans).
